data_description.meraki_api_key: Your Meraki Dashboard API key. Ensure it has read access to your organization.
data_description.meraki_org_id: The ID of your Meraki Organization. Found in the URL when logged into the Meraki Dashboard (e.g., o=YOUR_ORG_ID).
data_description.scan_interval: How often (in seconds) to poll the Meraki API for updates. Default: 300. A shorter interval means more responsive sensors but significantly increases API calls to Meraki Cloud and may lead to rate limiting.
data_description.webhook_url: A custom URL for Meraki webhooks. If left blank, the integration will use the default Home Assistant webhook URL.
data_description.device_name_format: Choose how device names are presented. 'Prefix' adds the Meraki device name before the entity name, 'Suffix' adds it after, 'Omitted' uses only the entity name.
data_description.auto_enable_rtsp: If checked, the integration will automatically enable the RTSP stream for all cameras that support it. This is useful for getting camera streams working without manual configuration in the Meraki dashboard.

abort.already_configured: This Meraki organization is already configured.

data_description.scan_interval: How often (in seconds) the integration should poll the Meraki Dashboard API for updates. Default: 300. A shorter interval means more responsive sensors but significantly increases API calls to Meraki Cloud and may lead to rate limiting.
data_description.webhook_url: A custom URL for Meraki webhooks. If left blank, the integration will use the default Home Assistant webhook URL.
data_description.device_name_format: Choose how device names are presented for entities. 'Prefix' adds the Meraki device name before the entity name, 'Suffix' adds it after, 'Omitted' uses only the standard entity name.
data_description.auto_enable_rtsp: If checked, the integration will automatically enable the RTSP stream for all cameras that support it. This is useful for getting camera streams working without manual configuration in the Meraki dashboard.
